Thanks to a funny and colorful universe, which covers all aspects of life, and to figures derived from real scientific data, the CARBONIQ game gives you all the cards to sustainably reduce your impact on the climate, with friends or family!

Gameplay:
After making up their carbon year, each player will have to try to improve their record in order to win the game. To do this, you will need to demonstrate strategy and bluff, but also be able to estimate the impact of your daily actions.

Each card represents an action: buy a smartphone, eat a big burger or go on holiday to Poitiers ... The carbon emission of this action is marked on the back, which allows you to compare in a fun way everything that makes up our daily life.

The more talented a player is in estimating the carbon impact of their actions, the more chance they have of improving their carbon year (or increasing that of others) and of winning the part. But beware: at any time, another player can give a very carbonated gift that risks tipping the scales!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Ancano
Description:
Ancano is a game created by certified and experienced yoga instructors to help children understand and express their anger in a creative and playful way. It also helps to develop interpersonal skills, positive self-expression, and healthy relationships with parents.

Each player takes turns rolling the dice and going down the journey. The game has 60 cards in total. There are 24 round shaped discovery cards that help children explore anger and build awareness. The discovery cards also consists of three different levels with 8 cards in each level. Next, are 18 diamond shaped activity cards that help kids understand what is underneath their anger. Lastly, there are 18 star shaped adventure cards.

Players roll the dice and move along the track, earning heart tokens.  These tokens can be used to move the players - or their opponents.  The first player to the finish square wins the game.

Name: Aetherstream: Interceptor
Description:
Interceptor is the game of space fighter combat to resolve these conflicts.  Pitting fighter against fighter, this is combat to control the local space around any important installation, location or convoy.

Fighter movement is accomplished using a maneuver template to choose a destination hex. If the cost to move to that hex is within the fighter's capabilities, it moves there with no problem, if it is greater, players must choose whether to risk damaging the fighter or injuring the pilot to get into that perfect spot.

All rolls (Combat, Piloting, etc.) are performed using a dice pool of ten-sided die with a limit of 10 dice and rolling against a target number of 7. Every dice showing a "7" or higher is a success and compared to a difficulty number. If the number of success is equal to or higher than the difficulty number, the task resolved successfully.

Players build their force from a point value determined by the scenario. Each fighter and pilot has an associated point value. Victory is determined when players accomplishing the goal for their scenario.

—description from designer

We would like to take a few minutes to address the comments that this is not the original Interceptor:

After many, many fruitless years trying to regain the rights to Renegade Legion, we decided to come up with our own new line. Rather than republish the exact same game system of 34 years ago, we decided to improve Interceptor and make it a better, fun and fast playing game. We believe we have achieved this goal.

Sincerely,

FASA Games

-Comment from designer on Kickstarter

Name: EDO
Description:
EDO A strategy game.

It contains 35 pieces that represent different classes involved in the war of the Sengoku period (1467-1568) in Japan. Final peace and order would come with the arrival of the Edo period, which would become the trigger for the objective of the game ... to end the war.

It is played by placing chips and subtracting the values of the sides that are in contact in that play. The value that remains is the points you add that turn ... and so on until you reach 100 points or the one with the most points after exhausting all the chips.

—description from publisher

Name: Revolutis
Description:
REVOLUTIS is a deck based on the Spanish deck, modified in design to generate games that are richer in history and in possibilities of complexity.

The first thing you will notice is that the suits are well differentiated and it is because they represent 4 estates of medieval times. The game contains rules for traditional games, and also contains rules for new and revolutionary games to play with the deck of cards.

Players assemble characters with three cards (one for the head, one for the torso and one for the legs).  They will also have two classic jokers and a special one for each suit; in addition to the inclusion of the character of "Devil".  The player with the most points wins.

—description from publisher

Name: Medusa: El Desafío del Héroe
Description:
Medusa: The Hero's Challenge from EPICA Games is a game where mighty Gods, brave Monsters, and ferocious Heroes face off in an all or nothing battle, recreating the Greek myth of Medusa and Perseus.

Fight your way to victory and eliminate all other players to be crowned victor. Choose between Perseo, Zeus, Andromeda, Atenea or Las Grayas (Graeae) to help you pave your path to victory.

Name: Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game – Bonus Box #1
Description:
A small expansion to the Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game that includes a new playable character.

Contains:

-1 White Ranger character card
-White Ranger signature item & zord cards
-4 cards for the Grid
-Dual layered Zord Bay tile
-Alternate art health tracker dials

Name: PinchanPlaf
Description:
The game of combat puppets! Duel in a game of fencing, pop the rival's balloon and win the game!

You can control the sword and shield of your puppet using the correspoding handlebars. Manuever your weapons to pop your rival's balloon to win the duel.

—user summary
